questions.text: Founder members of Vision 2020 are all except:

options.label: D
options.text: International Agency for Prevention of Blindness

questions.explanation:
Solution:

UNICEF UNICEF , originally called the United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund in full, now officially United Nations Children's Fund, is an agency of the United Nations responsible for providing humanitarian and developmental aid to children worldwide

Highyeild:

Vision 2020 aims to eliminate avoidable causes of childhood blindness by the year 2020 Strategies The objective is to eliminate avoidable blindness by the year 2020 and to reduce the global burden of blindness. WHO is included as the founding member of Vision 2020. Strengthening primary eye care programmes within primary healthcare to eliminate preventable causes Developing therapeutic and surgical support services to deal effectively with curable eye problems ORBIS is included in the founding members of Vision 2020. Establishing optical and low-vision services Activities include - Elimination of preventable blindness by Measles IMMUNIZATION A supplementation Avoidance of harmful traditional practices Monitoring oxygen levels in premature newborn

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A.WHO is included as the founding member of Vision 2020 . We are strengthening primary eye care programmes within primary healthcare to eliminate preventable causes. Option: C. ORBIS is included as the founding member of Vision 2020. We are establishing optical and low-vision services. Option: D. International Agency for Prevention of Blindness is included in the list. We are promoting school screening programmes.

Extraedge:

The International Agency for Prevention of Blindness is included in the list. Promoting school screening programmes Promoting eye health education in schools Management of surgically avoidable causes Immediate attention to achieve the goals of Vision 2020 are Cataract Childhood blindness Trachoma Refractive error and low vision Onchocerciasis

questions.text: Mention the appropriate vision centres according to the following image of "Vision 2020 The Right To Sight"
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Secondary - Service Centres. Service centres are the Secondary level of Vision 2020 Vision 2020 is an initiative started Globally to eliminate Avoidable Blindness started by WHO and IAPB as a joint programme. Primary level - primary level Vision centres. Secondary level - Service Centres. Tertiary level - Training Centres. Advanced Tertiary- Centre Of Excellence.

Highyeild:

The following image shows the various levels of centres with their respective strategies.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Primary level - primary level Vision centres. Option: C. Tertiary level - Training Centres. Option: D. Advanced Tertiary- Centre of Excellence.

questions.text: Which among the following statements given below are included in the objectives of Vision 2020 The Right To Sight Necessary resources to put the Initiative into action Facilitate planning and development of the initiative in almost all countries Increase awareness about Avoidable Blindness, its causes and solutions Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

A, b and c All the above three statements are objectives of the Initiative - " Vision 2020 The Right To Sight." Objectives include Increase awareness about Avoidable Blindness, its causes, risk factors and solutions to those complaints Necessary resources to put the Initiative of GAP into action should be secured Facilitate planning and development of the initiative in almost all countries The original plan that was begun was replaced by WHO Global Action Plan 2014 - 19’.It is based on the simple notion that every human has the right to sight. It targets to reduce the visual impairment that is usually preventable by 25% by the year 2020.

Highyeild:

The following image shows the various levels of centres with their respective strategies.

questions.text: The Indian Government adopted the program "VISION 2020", which was being implemented by WHO as a priority for the overall Health Development of the country. Which of the following conditions of the eye are NOT included among the five key areas of action?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Glaucoma Glaucoma is not included among the five key action areas under the "VISION 2020 THE RIGHT TO SIGHT " but is still considered a disease of National Importance. The five main priority areas of action under this programme include cataract, trachoma, onchocerciasis, childhood blindness (including vitamin A deficiency), and refractive error and low vision.

Highyeild:

" Vision 2020 The Right To Sight " Objectives include Increase awareness about Avoidable Blindness, its causes, risk factors and solutions to those complaints Necessary resources to put the Initiative of GAP into action should be secured Facilitate planning and development of the initiative in almost all countries The original plan that was begun was replaced by WHO Global Action Plan 2014 - 19’.It is based on the simple notion that every human has the right to sight. It targets to reduce the visual impairment that is usually preventable by 25% by the year 2020.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A.i. Cataract Option: C. ii . Trachoma Refractive Error and Low Vision Option: B. iv.. Childhood Blindness V .Onchocerciasis These priorities are listed in the order of importance to be acted upon. Option D. Other Diseases Of National Importance including Corneal Blindness, Diabetic Retinopathy and Glaucoma) are to be acted upon as well.

Extraedge:

The following image shows the various levels of centres with their respective strategies.

questions.text: The program VISION 2020 was initiated to eliminate Avoidable Blindness globally. Which of the following statements below are NOT included among the strategies/responsibilities undertaken by the program to reach its goals?

options.label: A
options.text: Increasing Awareness and implementing specific programs to control various causes of Avoidable Blindness

options.label: B
options.text: Building adequate Eye care facilities with appropriate technology for diagnosis and treatment

options.label: C
options.text: Training eye care workers, including Ophthalmologists, to create a strong foundation

options.label: D
options.text: Better diagnosis and treatment of emergencies like Cystoid Macular Oedema and Central Serous Retinopathy

questions.correct_answer: D. Better diagnosis and treatment of emergencies like Cystoid Macular Oedema and Central Serous Retinopathy
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Better diagnosis and treatment of emergencies like Cystoid Macular Oedema and Central Serous Retinopathy Diagnosis and Management of emergencies are not part of the VISION 2020 programme . It mainly includes causes of Avoidable Blindness like cataracts, trachoma, Refractive errors, Childhood Blindness and Onchocerciasis.

Highyeild:

The three main strategies/ responsibilities undertaken by the programme to reach its goals include the following. Increasing Awareness and implementing specific programs to control various causes of Avoidable Blindness. Building adequate Eye care facilities with appropriate technology for diagnosis and treatment. Training eye care workers, including Ophthalmologists, to create a strong foundation.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Increasing Awareness and implementing specific programs to control various causes of Avoidable Blindness: Included among the strategies/responsibilities undertaken by the program Option: B. Building adequate Eye care facilities with appropriate technology for diagnosis and treatment: Included among the strategies/responsibilities undertaken by the program. Option: C. Training eye care workers, including Ophthalmologists, to create a strong foundation: Included among the strategies/responsibilities undertaken by the program

Extraedge:

The following image shows the various levels of centres with their respective strategies.

questions.text: VISION 2020 recommends a 4 tier level of service delivery. It is represented as a pyramid where the basic facilities are placed at the base and goes to the top as levels go higher as seen in the image. Which of the following options are true regarding the strength of the facility centres?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Service Centres - 2000 Service centres are implemented at a strength of 2000 under the programme of VISION 2020 The various levels of the pyramidal structure under the programme are as follows - Primary level - Primary Vision centres - 20000 Secondary level - Service Centres - 2000 Tertiary level - Training Centres - 200 Advanced Tertiary- Centre Of Excellence - 20

Highyeild:

" Vision 2020 The Right To Sight " Objectives include Increase the awareness about Avoidable Blindness,it causes, risk factors and solutions to those complaints Necessary resources to put the Initiative of GAP into action should be secured Facilitate planning and development of the initiative in almost all countries The original plan that was begun was replaced by WHO Global Action Plan 2014 - 19’.It is based on a simple notion that every human has the right to sight. It targets in reducing the visual impairment that is usually preventable by 25% by the year 2020.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: B. Vision centres 200000: Primary level - Primary Vision centres - 20000 Option: C . Centre Of excellence- 200: Advanced Tertiary- Centre Of Excellence - 20 Option: D . Training centres – 20000: Tertiary level - Training Centres - 200

Extraedge:

The three main strategies/ responsibilities of VISION 2020 undertaken by the programme to reach its goals include the following: Increasing Awareness and implementing specific programs to control various causes of Avoidable Blindness. Building adequate Eye care facilities with appropriate technology for diagnosis and treatment. Training eye care 4-tiers, including Ophthalmologists, to create a strong foundation.

questions.text: The different causes of childhood Blindness have been classified broadly into Two groups - Anatomical and Etiological Classification. Which among the following causes of impaired Vision in childhood is NOT included in the Anatomical Classification ?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ophthalmia Neonatorum Ophthalmia Neonatorum occurs within the first month of life. It is a bacterial, chlamydial or viral infection acquired during passage through an infected birth canal. Most common agent causing the disease is Neisseria gonorrhoea and is a cause of sexually transmitted disease.

Highyeild:

Opthalmia Neonatorum is placed under the category of Aetiological Classification All others are examples of Anatomical Classification of preventable childhood Blindness The table given below shows the Classification of both the groups - Anatomical & Etiological Anatomical classification Whole globe: microphthalmos, anophthalmos, phthisis bulbi, atrophic bulbi Cornea: scar, anterior staphyloma, dystrophy Lens: cataract, dislocation, aphakia Uvea: aniridia, coloboma, uveitis Retina: retinopathy of prematurity, retinal dystrophy, retinal detachment, vasculitis Glaucoma: buphthalmos Optic nerve optic atrophy, hypoplasia Other: cortical blindness, amblyopia Aetiological classification Hereditary: chromosomal disorders, single-gene defects Intrauterine: congenital rubella, fetal alcohol syndrome Perinatal: ophthalmia neonatorum, retinopathy of prematurity, birth trauma Childhood: vitamin A deficiency, measles, trauma Unclassified: impossible to determine the underlying cause

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Corneal Scar: Under Anatomical Classification of Childhood blindness. Option: B. Optic Nerve Atrophy: Under Anatomical Classification of Childhood blindness. Option: D. Lens dislocation: Under Anatomical Classification of Childhood blindness.

Extraedge:

Preventing Ophthalmia Neonatorum by cleaning babies' eyes and applying 1% tetracycline ointment.

questions.text: It is known that more than 50% of childhood Blindness is preventable if necessary actions are taken. Actions taken are placed into various levels of care given. Which among the following prevention/management plans are NOT included at the Primary Care Level ?

options.label: A
options.text: Prophylactic doses of Vitamin A to children from areas of high prevalence

options.label: C
options.text: Prevention of Ophthalmia Neonatorum by 1% tetracycline Eye ointment

questions.correct_answer: B. Treatment of Retinopathy of Prematurity
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Treatment of Retinopathy of Prematurity Treatment plans for Retinopathy of Prematurity belongs to the Tertiary Care level (not Primary) All others belong to the primary level of care given.

Highyeild:

At Secondary Level Eye injury Management Corneal Ulcer Treatment Refractive Error Correction Proper Case Referrals to higher centers At Tertiary Level (Option B) Screening and Management of ROP Cataract Surgeries Glaucoma management Treatment of Corneal Scars.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Prophylaxis and Treatment of Vitamin A deficiency Option: C. Preventing Ophthalmia Neonatorum by cleaning babies' eyes and applying 1% tetracycline ointment Option: D. Measles Immunization 7 Rubella Vaccination in all 1-year-old children and also for prepubertal girls

Extraedge:

Retinopathy of prematurity
